protocol_name: Scanning Electron Microscopy imaging for Opaline Silica Single Cell Skeletons (Polycystines Radiolaria)
protocol_name_html: Scanning Electron Microscopy imaging for Opaline Silica Single Cell Skeletons (Polycystines Radiolaria)
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"a5v5r","text":"After DNA extraction, recover skeleton from the eluted pellet under binoculars or inverted microscope. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":103,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qki1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5e29v","text":"Note: During DNA extraction: dilute waste from the extraction procedure (i.e. pellet debris, containing the skeleton) in milliQ water and store skeletons at -20\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":163,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"13je1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"12jf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6vh92","text":"Protocol adapted from Biard et al. (2015).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":42,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"94qqc","text":"Biard, T., Pillet, L., Decelle, J., Poirier, C., Suzuki, N., Not, F., 2015. Towards an Integrative Morpho-molecular Classification of the Collodaria (Polycystinea, Radiolaria). Protist 166, 374\u2013388. doi:10.1016\/j.protis.2015.05.002","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":231,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b2b4l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"29763A735403474FB939A51444E334C2","id":673020,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Recovering skeletons"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eteoe","text":"Rinse skeleton several times in milli-Q water to decrease the concentration of SDS and other lysis and DNA precipitation reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"050CFEE454344E0F9F56D04A03A6B3CA","id":673021,"previous_id":673020,"previous_guid":"29763A735403474FB939A51444E334C2","section":"Rinsing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b00s","text":"Transfer skeleton into 1.5 ml Eppendorf tubes containing 50 \u00b5l of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":86,"length":1,"style":"sub"},{"offset":88,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3BAED0028C01482795A91D28D749C59E","id":673022,"previous_id":673021,"previous_guid":"050CFEE454344E0F9F56D04A03A6B3CA","section":"Cleaning"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9bs9","text":"Heat at 70\u00b0C for 10 min to remove residual organic matter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0F61F0B544B84D29808A677B338CC109","id":673023,"previous_id":673022,"previous_guid":"3BAED0028C01482795A91D28D749C59E","section":"Cleaning"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3n7sg","text":"Handpick skeleton under binoculars or inverted microscope and repeat several rinsing steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":91,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A7480415EF7B448BBBA359DEDB705D85","id":673025,"previous_id":673024,"previous_guid":"07D6D572ED5A4205B0ACCCA1B9CDF278","section":"Rinsing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2qll6","text":"Transfer skeleton in a glued SEM pin stub mount with the less water as possible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ghil","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"afjb0","text":"Note: no polycarbonate membrane, place the skeleton directly in the glue of the pin stub.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"89170C4509594442A074A1926FF95636","id":673026,"previous_id":673025,"previous_guid":"A7480415EF7B448BBBA359DEDB705D85","section":"Preparing for imaging"}
